conclusion: Understand how the position and size of shadows change when the light source moves downward.
The light source is currently positioned at the top of the image, casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D on the ground.
When the light source moves downward, the shadows will shift due to the change in the angle of the light relative to the objects.
